author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: California Democrats are pushing a plan to redraw the state’s congressional boundaries, a move aimed at countering a Republican redistricting effort in Texas that could help President Donald Trump’s party win more seats in Congress.
title: ‘Fight Fire With Fire:’ California Democrats Plan Redistricting

author: Loren Grush
description: NASA’s acting administrator Sean Duffy plans to accelerate the construction of a nuclear reactor that could be used on the moon and alter the way NASA will partner with industry to replace the aging International Space Station.
title: NASA Acting Chief Duffy Issues Directive to Speed Up Moon Reactor Plans

author: Justin Sink
description: President Donald Trump’s expanded reciprocal tariffs will not apply to any products loaded onto a vessel for transport into the United States before 12:01 a.m. New York time on Thursday, according to guidance issued by US Customs and Border Protection.
title: Trump Administration Posts Guidance on Tariff Rollout

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump is expected to sign an executive order on Tuesday establishing a task force for the 2028 Summer Olympics and Paralympics, which will be held in Los Angeles during his term.
title: Trump to Sign Order Creating Task Force for 2028 Olympics in LA

author: Lucy White
description: The UK government said it would begin detaining small-boat migrants “within days” to be sent back to France, as the two countries prepared to formalize a “one in, one out” treaty on Tuesday.
title: UK to Detain Small-Boat Migrants Within Days to Return to France

author: Daniel Carvalho, Andrew Rosati
description: Jair Bolsonaro was ordered into house arrest by a justice of Brazil’s top court who said the former president disobeyed a ban from using social media while standing trial for an alleged coup attempt.
title: Bolsonaro Ordered Into House Arrest for Disobeying Brazil Court

author: Stephanie Baker, Aaron Kirchfeld
description: Armin Papperger runs a German defense company arming Ukraine. The efforts have brought the weapons supplier unprecedented riches, and put a target on his back.
title: Russia’s Secret War and the Plot to Kill a German CEO

author: Chris Dolmetsch
description: A pair of Jeffrey Epstein’s victims blasted the Trump administration and the Justice Department for their attempts to unseal grand jury testimony in the criminal case against the late financier, saying government officials haven’t listened to the voices of people who were harmed by his actions.
title: Epstein Victims Express Disgust, Fear at Handling of Files

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Setting the Odds for Congress Avoiding a Shutdown

author: Myles Miller
description: The Trump administration is backing away from a widely cited immigration enforcement target, telling a federal appeals court there is no formal policy requiring agents to arrest 3,000 people a day.
title: White House Denies 3,000-a-Day ICE Arrest Target

author: Charlotte Hughes-Morgan, Indy Scholtens
description: The Netherlands will contribute €500 million ($579 million) to Ukraine’s defense as part of a US initiative, making it the first NATO country to donate funds through the new program.
title: Dutch to Supply Ukraine With €500 Million in Arms From US Reserves

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel’s cabinet voted to terminate the country’s attorney general, who it has been trying to oust for months, but the Supreme Court quickly issued an injunction to block the move pending a review of its legality.
title: Israel Moves to Fire Attorney General Citing Lack of Trust

author: Joe Lovinger, Julie Fine, Isis Almeida
description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott is threatening to seek the expulsion of Democratic lawmakers who left the state to block a controversial vote on new congressional maps. The Democrats said they’d like to see him try.
title: Texas Governor Threatens to Expel Democrats Who Fled State to Block Redistricting Vote

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil plans to bring up the issue of quotas for European steel when he meets with his US counterpart Scott Bessent.
title: German Finance Chief Plans to Ask Bessent About Quotas for Steel

author: Kateryna Chursina
description: Ukraine’s Security Service said its drones destroyed one jet and damaged four at Saki military airfield overnight, aiming to weaken Russia’s war capability in the occupied Crimea and on the Black Sea.
title: Ukraine Says Its Drones Hit Five Jets at Russian Airfield

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: The United Nations’ food agency will shut half of its clinics in Nigeria’s conflict-ravaged northeast region this month, as it begins winding down humanitarian support due to aid cuts.
title: United Nations to Close 150 Clinics in Nigeria as Aid Cuts Hit Food Relief

author: Dan Williams
description: Israel will this week make a fresh plan on how to achieve its goals in Gaza, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, urging national unity in the face of global outrage at the humanitarian toll in the Palestinian territory.
title: Israel Working on New Gaza Strategy Following International Outcry

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said he would be “substantially raising” the tariff on Indian exports to the US over New Delhi’s purchases of Russian oil, ramping up his threat to target a major trading partner.
title: Trump Says US to Hike India’s Tariffs Over Russian Oil Buys

author: Liam Knox, Amanda Albright
description: As a growing number of the wealthiest US colleges capitulate in their battles with the Trump administration, the strain from lost and frozen federal funding is putting pressure on the remaining holdouts to cut a deal.
title: Badly Bruised Universities Are Rushing to Cut Deals With Trump

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: Johannesburg’s mayor has been asked to explain how South Africa’s richest city will recoup 24.4 billion rand ($1.4 billion) of funds squandered in “unauthorized, irregular, fruitless and wasteful expenditure.”
title: Johannesburg Mayor Asked to Explain $1.4 Billion of Wasted Funds

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Hugo Miller
description: The Swiss government said it is determined to win over the US on trade after last week’s shock annoucement of 39% tariffs on exports to America.
title: Swiss Are Ready to Make More Attractive Trade Offer to US

author: Jan-Henrik Foerster, Jack Ryan
description: The trade imbalances that prompted President Donald Trump to slap hefty levies on Swiss imports have been driven by a small industry at the center of the world’s gold market.
title: Swiss Gold Trading Takes Spotlight in Trade Talks With Trump

author: Robb Mandelbaum
description: The Trump administration has set its sights on the PhD Project, which points underrepresented students toward business doctorates.
title: Government Steps Up Campaign Against Business School Diversity

author: Carolina Gonzalez
description: Chile’s financial market is preparing for the victory of ultra-conservative candidate Jose Antonio Kast in presidential elections this year, unfazed by the rise of a communist contender in the ruling alliance, a monthly survey shows.
title: Investors Dismiss Spectre of Communist Victory in Chile Election

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa’s government is putting the final touches to an overarching package that aims to shield businesses against the fallout from punitive US trade tariffs and plans to present it to lawmakers later this week.
title: South Africa Readies Plan to Offset Trump’s Tariffs Fallout

author: Rodney Jefferson
description: Scotland’s deputy leader and economy minister, Kate Forbes, said she will step down at the next election.
title: Scottish Deputy First Minister Forbes to Step Down Next Year

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Hugo Miller
description: The Swiss government held crisis talks on Monday to come up with a proposal that might dissuade US President Donald Trump from imposing 39% tariffs on the country in less than three days.
title: Swiss Face 72-Hour Race to Lower Trump’s ‘Absurd’ 39% Tariff

author: Anthony Halpin
description: It’s unclear what cards Trump has left to play in making good on his pledge to end the war.
title: Putin May Turn Trump's Impatience to Advantage

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: The Philippines’ House of Representatives on Monday asked the Supreme Court to reverse its decision nullifying the impeachment case against Vice President Sara Duterte over an apparent threat to assassinate President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
title: Philippines’ House Challenges Court Ruling Invalidating VP Duterte’s Impeachment

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is expecting US President Donald Trump to announce executive actions this week to formalize the bloc’s lower tariffs for cars and grant exemptions from levies for some industrial goods such as aviation parts, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Awaits Trump Actions on Its Car Tariffs, Exemptions This Week

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Suspended Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra is seeking a fair hearing from a court probing allegations of ethical misconduct related to her handling of a border dispute with Cambodia, an official said.
title: Suspended Thai PM Hopes for Fair Court Ruling in Ethics Case

author: Josh Xiao, Kamran Haider
description: Pakistan has officially added a new Chinese attack helicopter to its military arsenal — the Z-10ME — a similar model to the one China uses to patrol its border with India.
title: Pakistan Adds Chinese Attack Helicopters to Upgrade Aging Fleet

author: Michael Heath
description: Australian Federal Police have charged a Chinese national with foreign interference relating to the covert collection of information, in a case that raises the risk of sparking renewed tensions with Beijing.
title: Australia Charges Chinese National With Foreign Interference

author: Ana Monteiro
description: South Africa plans to seek new markets for its goods to offset the impact on its exports from Washington’s imposition of 30% tariffs on the nation’s goods entering the US.
title: South Africa to Boost Continental Trade Ties as US Tariffs Bite

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japanese food exports in the first six months of 2025 hit a record high of ¥809.7 billion ($5.5 billion) according to the agriculture ministry.
title: Japanese Food Exports in First Half of 2025 Hit Record High

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Swiss inflation unexpectedly accelerated, a reading that will be welcomed by policymakers mulling whether to reintroduce negative interest rates.
title: Swiss Inflation Unexpectedly Quickens, Offering SNB Respite

author: Thomas Kutty Abraham
description: Senior security officials from Cambodia and Thailand began talks in Malaysia on Monday aimed at de-escalating border tensions, after the worst clash between the two Southeast Asian nation neighbors in decades left more than 40 dead.
title: Cambodia, Thailand Begin Talks After Biggest Clashes in Decades

author: Josh Xiao
description: US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer sounded a cautiously optimistic note on discussions with China on rare earth flows, following trade talks that further steadied ties between the economies.
title: Greer Says US-China Talks ‘About Halfway There’ on Rare Earths

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung’s popularity rose after a last-minute trade deal with the US.
title: South Korean President’s Approval Rises After US Trade Deal

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Rakesh Sharma, Preeti Soni
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi struck a defiant tone in the face of US President Donald Trump’s tariff threats, urging the nation to buy local goods as his administration signaled it would continue buying Russian oil.
title: Modi Defiant as Trump Steps Up Pressure on India’s Russia Oil Purchases

author: Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump said he will announce a new Federal Reserve governor and a new jobs data statistician in the coming days, two appointments that could shape his economic agenda.
title: Trump to Announce Fed, Jobs Data Replacements in Coming Days
